questions.clue: Home to King Edward Elementary school, this neighbourhood shares its name with a county, former city, and federal and provincial ridings
The second most-dense neighbourhood in Edmonton which, if we’re being “frank”, probably deserves more green amenities
Despite its name, this Edmonton neighbourhood just north of Londonderry mall isn’t proposing an assault on the premier, rather it’s named after a community in Ireland.
Even well after 2009, you won’t be able to get a degree in this Edmonton neighbourhood just south of the Henday off 111st
The only residential neighbourhood in Edmonton to contain two “y”s, this neighbourhood seems to be encouraging you to just do nothing for a while during your stay

The contestant here with the highest ward, multiplied by the total number of members on council

“Missing Links” was nomenclature that was used in an official motion after being popularized by this local people-focused organization that champions moving around without the use of personal vehicles
Banga, Dziadyk, Nickel, and Paquette all voted against the phase 1 gondola report, rejecting the idea born in this competition which encouraged Edmontonians to dream big and imagine something new
Though it was shelved in budget deliberations, they were the only councillor to vote against the Lewis Farms Rec Centre and Library earlier this year
While options for privacy and noise remediation in Councillor offices ranged from $500k to $5.2M, council instead opted for this cheaper solution, at $25k
A review of Tim Hague’s death prompted council to implement a temporary ban on this in late 2017
“I know criticism is a summer sport here in Edmonton”
“I think I’ve got a bunch of what I call ‘economic crisis deniers’ going right now”
“I don’t think there’s a true mobility function to e-scooters. I think they’re a toy, they’re fun.”
“Quite frankly, I want to get up on a Saturday from my house and just drive two minutes to my office so that I can meet with people on weekends and in the evenings”
“I’m not the kind of political leader that’s ever chained myself to anything before or laid down in front of a bulldozer, but when it comes to this ballpark I just might be”

questions.answer: Elk Island National Park and Ride

questions.clue: The Fire Chief moves his retirement announcement to a Whyte Coffee Shop in a building that’s 107 years old

final.clue: This building, first built in 1938 and the first in Canada, was instrumental in growing a faith group in Edmonton. Now, nearly two decades after the building was moved to make way for the Royal Alex in 1991, Edmontonians can visit the original building in Fort Edmonton Park
